item.title: Urgent Refuse Mismanagement & Fly-tipping Hazard, 16th December
item.description:
I am writing to report a serious and recurring issue of refuse mismanagement, which is now creating a significant environmental hazard and public nuisance on the street. The residents have repeatedly placed their refuse bins out on the wrong days, and this time, they have put all their four black bins out during the recycling week (the wrong week) and have severely overfilled them. They also added an extra, non-standard bin, which was quickly torn open by foxes, spreading large amounts of litter across the public pathway and street. This widespread mess is attracting rodents and poses a health risk to the public. Things will only get worse, as when the correct collection day for general waste arrives next week, the bins will be rejected by the collection crew because they are overfilled and incorrectly presented. This failure to collect will leave a substantial volume of waste uncollected and overflowing on the pavement throughout the Christmas period, causing a prolonged and severe nuisance for all neighbours and pedestrians. I urge your team to take corrective action to prevent a prolonged unsanitary situation over the holidays. Thank you for your prompt attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Randlesdown Road, Southend, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over hanging branches and deadwood coming into the road, 16th December
item.description:
On the way up to the station from the mini roundabout there is a lot of fallen dead wood and lose branches overhanging and landing in the road. It’s worst on the bend which causes traffic to brake or swerve. Residents are occasionally pushing the large branches up the verge but they come back down in the winds. Needs clearing back before there is an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of dog mess on the street, 16th December
item.description:
There are two loads of dog mess on the corner of Townley St and Morecambe St. They have been there for around 2 weeks now, to the point where mold is now growing on the dog mess. I'll spare you a gross photo, but can someone come and clean this? Might be worth putting a few signs telling people to clean up after their dog. It's disgusting and happens semi-regularly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Townley Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping outside recycling bins, 16th December
item.description:
Recycling bins are empty / has space but piles of bin bags filled with recycling and rubbish dumped in front and on top of bins. Blocking food waste bin, unclean and unsightly. Encourages additional dumping and mess. Problem for months

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chart Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover clicking at every car, 16th December
item.description:
Since the road markings were redone, the manhole cover has been clicking every time a car passes over it. It’s very loud, especially knowing that 20 to 30 cars can make it click every minute. It’s a nightmare because rooms are on the same side, and there is cars non stop day and night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Crayford Road, Crayford, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping + overgrown hedge, 16th December
item.description:
Bits of bed and a wheelie-bin dumped behind the bus-shelter at the beginning of the Welling Way. Seriously overgrown hedge filling the space between the bus-shelter and the boundary of the house. This area has been a mess for a considerable time and is lowering the tone of the neighbourhood. Please tidy it up by: removing the rubbish; cutting the hedge back to the boundary. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16,16A, Welling Way, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
